intro: Knoxia platycarpa var. hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy knoxia, is a rare and unique plant species native to specific regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its distinctive, elongated, and often hairy fruits, which give it its scientific name. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and may have a waxy coating to reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
